page.title: 08Market Place,Pontefract.
page.content: Market Place is in the centre of Pontefract.The streets Beastfair, Horsefair,Cornmarket,Shoemarket, and Woolmarket remind us of the town's origin as a Market town. Market Place,pedestrised in 1976 is 100m long.St.Giles church stands at the N.W.corner, with the 240 year old Buttercross in front.At the E.end the Town Hall faces up to precinct no longer used for administration it is used for dancers,bazars and concerts. Many of the buildings are listed Gorgian buldings .The market hall has a high facade with carved animal heads . Amongsted the buildings are banks, building societie, tv shoerooms and 4 inns .Other shops are high street chain stores .Few faimly shops remain .Twice a week a market is held. behind the market place is the libery musem and a row of new shops.
